definition: to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship

sentences.english: Our Chinese ancestors came across the ocean, sailing south to find a way for living.
sentences.chinese: 我们的族祖先飘洋过海，下南洋讨生活。

sentences.english: At the time, we thought Japan was going to have us for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
sentences.chinese: 当时我们觉得要向日本人讨生活了。

sentences.english: My ancestors rode around on horses.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖先在马背上讨生活。

sentences.english: Those who live by the sword will die by the sword.
sentences.chinese: 在刀子里讨生活的人，迟早死在刀子下。

sentences.english: Everybody has to make a living.
Workers and managers didn't live quite so much on the knife-edge of the market.
sentences.chinese: 当时的工人和管理层并不都是在市场的刀刃上讨生活。

sentences.english: I have made a living by means of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 老鞋一直以做教书匠讨生活。

sentences.english: You are fisherman, who make a living from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 你是渔民，从大海中讨生活。

sentences.english: Baby boy, the streets, it's all that you know.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩，讨生活，你也知道的。

definition: to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to live one's life/to make a living
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to ask for food/to beg
livelihood
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to make a living
to work hard/to try to make a living
